DESCRIPTION.P: This block allows user to read datas in a file, in formatted or binary mode. Output record selection and Time record Selection allows the user to select data among file records.
Each call to the block advance one record in the file.

ITEM.label: Time record Selection
ITEM.SP: : an empty matrix or a positive integer. If an integer i is given the ith element of the read record is assumed to be the date of the output event. If empty no output event exists.

ITEM.label: Output record selection
ITEM.SP: : a vector of positive integer. [k1,..,kn],The kith element of the read record gives the value of ith output.

ITEM.label: Input file name
ITEM.SP: : a character string defining the path of the file

ITEM.label: Input Format
ITEM.SP: : a character string defining the Fortran format to use or nothing for an unformatted (binary) write. If given, the format must began by a left parenthesis and end by a right parenthesis. example: (e10.3).

ITEM.label: Buffer size
ITEM.SP: : To improve efficiency it is possible to buffer the input data. read on the file is only done after each Buffer size call to the block.

ITEM.label: size of output
ITEM.SP: : a scalar. This fixes the number of "value" read.
